contextId.information: These two extremes "small" and "great" represent all people. AT: "you will treat all people alike" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: you will hear the small and the great alike

contextId.information: The two phrases "in heaven" and "on the earth" show two extremes and mean "everywhere." AT: "over everything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: in heaven above and on the earth beneath

contextId.information: These words show two extremes, and are combined to mean that all things everywhere belong to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

Using the different places "in your house" and "on the road," and the opposites "when you lie down" and "get up," represent anywhere, anytime.  The people of Israel were to discuss God's commandments and teach them to their children anytime and anywhere. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: when you sit in your house, when you walk on the road, when you lie down, and when you get up

contextId.information: Here the reference to the two extremes of the earth means "everywhere on earth." AT: "throughout the entire earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: from the one end of the earth to the other end of the earth

contextId.information: This merism means that Yahweh will bless them everywhere. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: in the city ... in the field

contextId.information: This merism means that Yahweh will bless them everywhere. Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:03|28:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: in the city ... in the field

contextId.information: These two extremes together mean everywhere on earth. AT: "throughout the earth" or "all over the earth" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: from the one end of the earth to the other end of the earth

contextId.information: Here the extremes "go out" and "come in" used together mean that Moses can no longer do what a healthy person can do. AT: "I am no longer able to go everywhere that you need to go, so I cannot be your leader any longer" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: I can no more go out and come in
